attributes.action: Pressure China to stop culling dogs in response to their rabies problem
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
In many areas of China (eg Beijing), dogs over 35cm have to be handed over to be destroyed in response to their rabies problem - many dogs are being forcibly removed from families or are simply being clubbed to death in the street by officials. 
This is completely inhumane & there is no way of telling how many dogs are being killed in a totally unaccteptable & cruel way.
This policy is also not effective in combatting rabies.
In Beijing, there is a suspicion this policy relates to the 2008 Olympics & many Animal Welfare groups are calling on people to boycott the Olympic Games in protest.
